title: Citi Bahrain Hosts Khawla Secondary Girls School as Part of "Job Shadow" Program
summary: Manama - Citi Bahrain recently opened its doors to 11th- and 12th-grade students from Khawla Secondary Girls School. The teenagers explored the bank and asked their assigned Citibank hosts about their roles, activities and skill sets to learn how banks functioned.
tag-1: Citi Bahrain Hosts Khawla Secondary Girls School as Part of "Job Shadow" Program
tag-2: Manama – Citi Bahrain recently opened its doors to 11th- and 12th-grade students from Khawla Secondary Girls School. The teenagers explored the bank and asked their assigned Citibank hosts about their roles, activities and skill sets to learn how banks functioned.
tag-3: This activity was part of the "Job Shadow" program organized by inJAz-Bahrain in collaboration with Citi Bahrain to introduce career options and the skills required to enter the private sector.
tag-4: "Job Shadow" is a program implemented by inJAz Bahrain, a business education non-profit organization that is offering programs on entrepreneurship, financial literacy and work readiness for more than 13,630 students across the Kingdom during the academic year 2011-12 in cooperation with the Ministry of Education. As part of the program, students are partnered with private sector volunteers for one day for an authentic work world experience.
tag-5: Her Highness Shaikha Hessa Bint Khalifa Al Khalifa, Executive Director of inJAz Bahrain, said: "The purpose of the Job Shadow program is to highlight how important skills learnt in school are related to the workplace and can impact these students' future careers. We truly hope that this program will serve as a catalyst for smarter career choices for these students."
tag-6: "Citi Bahrain employees volunteer every semester in the Job Shadow and other Injaz programs as part of Citi's corporate social responsibility, with the aim of contributing to the development of the bankers of the future in Bahrain. Today's generation is fortunate to have such programs that can help them choose their careers in a clear and efficient way. Citi is pleased to play an active role in impacting the future of these students and help prepare them to meet the challenges of the real world," said Mazin Manna, CEO of Citi Bahrain.
tag-7: Volunteers from Citi introduced students to various aspects of running a bank including Customer Service, Human Resources, Public Relations, Citi Business Product and Relationship Management, and Cash Operations.
tag-8: The volunteers also had a chance to interact with the students and learn about their requirements.
tag-9: "Exposing these students to the private sector and some of its opportunities is an eye-opening experience to these students," said Ahmed Zayer from Citi and a volunteer for the day. "They were happy to learn about the various opportunities available to them and how a bank functions on a daily basis. We are proud to help them as this is the future of the nation that we are shaping."
tag-10: Citi has been in the Arab world for nearly 50 years and views the region as critical to its global franchise. It currently offers full scale corporate and investment banking services across 10 Arab countries, including Bahrain, UAE, Qatar, Kuwait, Lebanon, Jordan, Egypt, Tunisia, Morocco, Algeria and Pakistan.
tag-11: Citi is a global partner with Junior Achievement (JA) Worldwide, the parent organization of inJAz Bahrain and supports JA in many countries around the world including Bahrain. Across the world, JA reaches 4 million students every year in 173,000 classes. In the Middle East, more than 500,000 Arab students are reached out annually with the help of 10,000 corporate volunteers and partnerships with ministries of education.
tag-12: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
